name: Four Points by Sheraton Pittsburgh Airport

reviews.text: This property offers a generously- sized room with upscale lighting, furnishings and bathroom amenities. Room service has a 30 minute service guarantee which they beat handily.
reviews.title: Occupational Hearing Loss?

likes.disliked: — super-noisy HVAC unit, even by hotel standards

reviews.text: Previous reviews have noted that the location is "out of the way". I agree. If you are the type of person who doesn't bother with directions or maps then change your ways this time, or you will NEVER find it unaided! But once you locate the property, tucked into a little secret valley, you will fnd it is not too far away from a decent range of amenities just down the highway.
reviews.title: Stay away from this hotel!!!!

reviews.text: I'd be scoring this property a 3 or 4 except for one major flaw, also pointed out in a previous review. The newer-looking Amana wall unit for heating and AC produces the same ambient noise level as a vacuum cleaner running in the room. You'd probably adapt if the fan would run all the time, but whether I selected "on" or "auto" it cycled every 15 minutes or so. And when it did it was loud enough to drown out normal TV volume or phone calls. I'd realize my ears were ringing when it shut itself off. Most people wouldn't be able to sleep through it. And the window didn't open. With an outside temp in the 60's and low 70's during my stay, I was OK by cooling the room and then shutting it off, but I couldn't imagine staying here in the summer when this approach wouldn't work. Occupational hearing loss anyone?
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Here Again Unless Everything Else Was Sold Out

likes.liked: — The fact that I'm only here for 3 more nights
likes.disliked: — Dirty bathroom, room service screw ups, noisey heater, low hung shower head, off the beaten track

reviews.text: WARNING - DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!! I had reservations (secured with a credit card and a late arrival guarantee), but upon arrival was told that the hotel was overbooked by three rooms and no rooms were available. I had just flown in to Pittsburgh airport and had called for the complementary shuttle - you would have expected that they would inform me of the problem then... but no. Rather, after waiting 20 minutes for the shuttle which was supposed to have arrived within 15 min, I called back and was told that it would arrive within 10 minutes.... So, all in all, I waited 30 minutes for the shuttle and upon arrival wsa informed that they had just assigned the last room. When asked how this could possibly be when the only person at reception (Olivia) and I had spoken TWICE - and clearly she knew I was on my way... All I got was the "doe in the headlights" look and "I don't know."
reviews.title: Little out of the way

reviews.text: Their complimentary airport shuttle picked me up in a timely manner. The driver was courteous and good with my bags. The van was rather small and a bunch of people got on board, so it was a bit crowded, but I can't complain, because it's cheaper than taking a taxi.
reviews.title: So-so Sheraton

reviews.text: I stayed here after spending 3 nights in downtown Pittsburgh at the Sheraton Station Square, which was great but a little pricy.
reviews.title: Just what I needed!

reviews.text: I moved here because its Friday night and therefore its only 2000 points to get a room since its a Category 1.
reviews.title: Four Points Sheraton was okay

reviews.text: I was very impressed. The room was clean and quiet (except for the HVAC unit in the room), which is all I really care about.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but agree the a/c is too noisy

reviews.text: Hotel is basically in the middle of nowhere, but if the hotel's shuttle isn't busy they'll drive you to the local mall, which has lots of restaurants in/around it. Airport shuttle runs 24/7.

likes.liked: — the lobby decor and the genial receptionist
likes.disliked: — that they charge a large pet fee when Sheratons are billed as pet-friendly. Luckily I didn't have my pet this time.

reviews.text: I was very pleased with our stay at this Hotel. We stayed 1 night before we flew out for our vacation. I loved the Park and Fly program. We were shuttled to and from the airport. The room was very comfortable and clean. We liked the gym feature. The only thing we found was it was a hard place to find. We got lost but eventually found the hotel with some help from a wonderful stranger. Would stay there again if we get the chance.
reviews.title: Great stay
Very So-so Place, Not Impressed
reviews.text: This is very so-so place. I don't know why people give such a high rating (4.5/5), and there is NOTHING new or modern about it -- the carpet is worn, the wallpaper, the ceiling, the bed, the closet, etc. are all pretty USED.

My check in experience is good -- a 4/5 rating. But the bar/restaurant service is very very average. The food was not done very well -- I had a piece of pork chop and couldn't cut it with the bread knife the waitress / bartender gave me. The pork chop was way too big and way too "not done nicely". I couldn't ask for a steak knife, because as soon as I discovered the difficulty in cutting the pork, she had never been around to me. So finally I had to yell a really loud "EXCUSE me" to get her come. By then, it's already pass the time and appetite to really enjoy the meal. I just asked for the check.
reviews.title: One Point Sheraton

reviews.text: Next time I am in Pittsburgh, I will look for another place to stay.
reviews.title: Modern hotel with good airport shuttle service.

reviews.text: I booked this through Priceline which had it listed as a 3.5* property, equivalent to the Hyatt. It's nowhere near the Hyatt in quality and service.
reviews.title: Mix of Good and Bad

likes.liked: — Large room size and free fast wireless internet access
likes.disliked: — Loud Heating / AC unit and worn carpeting throughout

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel overnight before catching an early flight to Florida on May 11, 2006. This hotel room was by far one of the nicest rooms that I have ever stayed in !!! The lobby was very welcoming, the staff was very courteous. I got my room through a discount travel agency and would love to be able to be guaranteed that I could stay here every time I needed to stay in Pittsburgh. I would recommend this Four Points Sheraton hotel to anyone. Dave W. Williamstown,WV
reviews.title: Great one nighter............
Perfect place to stay to catch an early flight!
reviews.text: P.S. I'm posting pics also. It might seem wierd to take pictures of a hotel room, but I was so impressed by the quality of this place that I wanted to show my wife 'cause she'd never believe me !!!!!

We stayed at this hotel because of the shuttle service which was wonderful, because I have a card for that chain of hotels although I had only stayed at one other, the Sheraton at Station Sqare, and that was great too. The room was comfortable, quiet, clean, and the girl at the front desk was very nice and helpful. We had two different drivers for our shuttle service, both were efficient and prompt. Our car was in good shape when we returned after a week, and we did not have to haul our luggage all over the airport to come and go to our car. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a nice quiet place to stay near the airport.
reviews.title: Home away from home
PLeasant Stay
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton Pittsburgh Airport several times during the past year. Each stay has been quite enjoyable and it is a pleasure to walk through the doors knowing that my comfort and satisfaction is a key element with the courteous staff!

The rooms are quite spacious, bright and clean and provides a relaxing atmosphere. The beds are wonderful and offer a restful night's sleep. The Four Points by Sheraton is located off of the main traffic flow and the silence is an added plus!
reviews.title: Enjoyable
